title: Security Annotations Does not work on JaxRS resource interface
body:
### Describe the bug

There is nothing mentionned in JSR 250 about interfaces, but JAX-RS annotations may be used on the methods and method parameters of a super-class or an implemented interface.
However, specifying a role with @RoleAllowed on such an interface does not work,  and I think it can be misleading.

### Expected behavior

annotating an interface method with RoleAllowed make the underlying resource secure or an error is thrown at build time.

### Actual behavior

when a resource interface is annotated with @RolesAllowed, the resource is not secured.

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.6.1
